conbody.p:
The parameters for configuring a TCP/IP server are listed in the following table. TCP/IP outbound server parameters
Parameter
Description
Server Name*
Unique identifier for the TCP/IP server. This is used as the primary key. It can have a maximum of 50 characters.
Host/IP
Host name or IP address of the TCP/IP outbound server.
Port*
The port number used for the TCP/IP server. The default value is 80. The range is 0-65535.
Valid range: 1-65535
Default value: 80
Timeout
The time lapse (in milliseconds) allowed between a request and the corresponding response.
Valid range: 1-60000
Default value: 10000
Authentication
If set to true, this field checks for authentication of user name and password before sending the request.
Default value: false
User Name
The user name required for authentication. It can have a maximum 50 characters.
Note: This is mandatory if the authentication is set to true.
Password
The password required for authentication. It can have a maximum 100 characters.
Note: This is mandatory if the authentication is set to true.
Scheduling Algorithm
Used for identifying server algorithm.
Valid values: GENERIC, ROUNDROBIN
Description
The description of the TCP/IP server.
